etymologies: late Middle English: earlier spelling and pronunciation of ballad

definitions: a poem normally composed of three stanzas and an envoi. The last line of the opening stanza is used as a refrain, and the same rhymes, strictly limited in number, recur throughout.
shortDefinitions: poem consisting of one or more triplets of stanzas with repeated refrain

definitions: a short, lyrical piece of music, especially one for piano.
shortDefinitions: piece of music in romantic style with dramatic elements
